CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 28, 1956, pg. 3, reads: "Trussed-Up - Twenty-year-old Mamie Clark, handcuffed and manacled by deputy sheriffs to prevent another escape attempt like she waged in Criminal Court Monday after being sentenced, leaves the Allegheny County Jail Tuesday morning for 2 1/2 to 5 years in the Workhouse. - Harris Photo."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Vayson Robbery Girl Attempts Suicide Again, Battles Guards in Escape Try - A 20-year-old mother-to-be who on Monday injured three of six officers in a three-minute battle to escape and later threatened to jump from the third tier of bars she scaled at the County Jail, on Wednesday was returned to court in handcuffs and manacles and received a six-month sentence for assault and battery added to a two and one-half to five-year sentence she had previously received for burglary..."
TitMainTitle: Police escorting Mamie Clark handcuffed at ankles out of cell of Allegheny County Jail
